qa_pairs.question: How does BB Biotech's investment strategy and portfolio composition reflect its focus on small-to-mid-cap biotech companies, and what specific companies are highlighted as core holdings in its portfolio as of June 30, 2024?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>BB Biotech's investment strategy focuses on small-to-mid-cap biotech companies headquartered in Western Europe and the United States, emphasizing firms with established products or advanced drug candidates. This approach is reflected in its portfolio composition, which prioritizes fundamental analysis and long-only investments without financial risk-hedging instruments.<cite>[S10][S14][S13]</cite></statement> <statement>The company's portfolio comprises approximately 35 companies, including five to eight core holdings that account for around 70% of the total value, alongside smaller holdings and up to 10% in non-listed companies. This structure aligns with its focus on specialized biotech investments.<cite>[S16][S17][S18]</cite></statement> <statement>As of June 30, 2024, the core holdings in BB Biotech's portfolio include Ionis Pharmaceuticals (13.0%), Argenx (9.8%), Neurocrine Biosciences (8.6%), Vertex (8.1%), Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (7.3%), Revolution Medicines (6.4%), Moderna (6.1%), Intra-Cellular Therapies (5.6%), and Agios Pharmaceuticals (5.5%).<cite>[S19]</cite></statement>

# BB Biotech



**BB Biotech AG** is a Swiss investment company in the field of biotechnology. [S2] The company invests mainly in the United States and Western Europe and is managed by Bellevue Asset Management, a division of Bellevue Group, which is listed on the Swiss Stock Exchange. [S3] It is one of the largest investment companies in the biotech sector. [S4] ## History

BB Biotech was founded as an *Aktiengesellschaft* on November 9, 1993 in Schaffhausen, Switzerland. [S5] The company's shares have been traded on the SIX Swiss Exchange since December 27, 1993, and since December 10, 1997 on the German Deutsche Börse in Frankfurt. [S6] BB Biotech was listed on the TecDAX from 2003 to June 2012, and returned to it again between September 2012 and June 2015. [S7] The shares were listed on the Italian Nuovo Mercato from October 19, 2000 to September 4, 2023, since September 2005 in the Star segment (TechStar). [S8] ## Investment activities


### Investment area

As a closed-end fund, with its principal activity of specialised investments in companies operating in the biotech sector, BB Biotech is the oldest established and largest entity of its kind. [S9] Primary focus lies on small-to-mid-cap biotech companies headquartered in Western Europe and especially the United States market. [S10] The biotechnology companies in which BB Biotech invests are active, for example, in the fields of oncology, the development of drugs for the treatment of neurological disorders, metabolic diseases, cardiovascular diseases infectious diseases and autoimmune diseases. [S11] BB Biotech further concentrates on firms developing therapeutic products involving cell, gene and particularly RNA-based technologies. [S12] In contrast to other biotech specialists or hedge funds, Biotech is a long-only investor and does not need to rely on financial instruments to reduce individual stock or market risk. [S13] It targets biotechnology firms which either have previously established products in the marketplace or promising drug candidates in advanced development stages. [S14] ### Companies and core investments

While benchmarked against the Nasdaq Biotech index (in CHF), the company uses a bottom-up approach based on the fundamental analysis. [S15] Its portfolio comprises around 35 companies. [S16] The portfolio usually includes five to eight core holdings, which account for around 70% of the total value, as well as around two dozen smaller holdings. [S17] In addition, up to 10% may be held in non-listed companies (Private equity). [S18] The core investments in the BB Biotech portfolio as of June 30, 2024 included Ionis Pharmaceuticals (13.0%), Argenx (9.8%), Neurocrine Biosciences (8.6%), Vertex (8.1%), Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (7.3%), Revolution Medicines (6.4%), Moderna (6.1%), Intra-Cellular Therapies (5.6%) and Agios Pharmaceuticals (5.5%). [S19] ## Company structure

The Chairman of the Board of Directors since 2024 is Thomas von Planta; the Vice Chairman is Clive A. [S20] Meanwell. [S21] Bellevue Asset Management AG, which belongs to the Swiss Bellevue Group and is based in Küsnacht ZH, is commissioned with the areas of fundamental analysis, portfolio management, marketing and administration. [S22] The investment management team has been headed by Daniel Koller, who joined Bellevue in 2004, since 2010. [S23] BB Biotech's equity capital in the individual biotech companies is invested indirectly via the wholly owned subsidiaries Biotech Focus N.V., Biotech Invest N.V., Biotech Target N.V., Biotech Growth N.V., all of which are seated in Curaçao. [S24] ## Company figures
